q: and what we've always done is think about the next practice, " Steve Fairchild said." we don't want to look beyond anything other than having a good week of practice and playing well next saturday. next saturday's game at wyoming has added meaning with the bronze boot, the traveling trophy awarded to the team winning the annual border war. wyoming was eliminated from bowl contention thursday in its loss to unlv, and it is rumored Joe Glenn may be on his way out as head coach. so, in horinek's eyes, this week is all about first things first. we're going to go up and try and get that boot, first and foremost, "he said." if we can get into the postseason, that would be huge. we definitely want to go

catherine mcnabb, director, strategic clusters 1, business travel& mice group, singapore tourism board( stb), told delegates at the session called," sports tourism: the new engine of destination marketing, <q> that the singapore grand prix, the first night race in f1 history, attracted 100,000 spectators of whom 40,000 were foreign visitors. she reported that the three-day race and the three-week festival designed around it, which consisted of lifestyle events, attracted an estimated s$ 100 million in revenue. giving the hotelier's viewpoint, grahame carder, vice president of sales and marketing- asia pacific division for hyatt international, said, </q> we love sports. we love what it does for our occupancy and revenue. nick or norah is thinking about song lyrics. here is an early throwaway line describing nick shifting gears from performer to person taking down band equipment:" i go from chords to cords, amped to amps. and here's norah, musing on her own upbringing: my parents have also done me the misfortune of being happily married for a quarter century, which no doubt dooms my own prospects of ever experiencing true love. gold is not struck twice. i love that. gold is not struck twice. "there's also David Levithan 's description of moving through the crowd at a club, holding norah's hand: the crowd is pressing in on us and the bassline is revealing everything
